data.title: Track & Field signee: Mitchell Burelison of Centerville
data.meta_description: p>Mitchell Burelison, a recent Centerville (Ind.) ...
data.text:
Mitchell Burelison, a recent Centerville (Ind.) High School graduate, has signed a letter of intent to compete in track and field at Indiana University East starting with the 2015-16 school year.

Red Wolves track and field coach David Sanders announced the signing July 17.

"Mitchell is a guy who can come in and provide depth in different events," Sanders said. "He also has a chance to compete for relay opportunities if he comes in and works hard."

Burelison was a track and field team MVP at Centerville. He was part of a sectional champion 4x400 meter relay team in 2014. He qualified for regional in 4x400 meter relay this past spring. He scored in the sectional meet in the 100 meter dash and 300 meter hurdles during his high school career.

Mitchell is the son of Van and Tracey Burelison. He plans to major in criminal justice. He earned a "Perfect Attendance" award as a student at Centerville.

Burelison joins Parker West and Cody Spicer of Eastern Hancock (Ind.), Cole Dudley of National Trail (Ohio), Blake Brooks of Cowan (Ind.), Seth Reynolds of Eaton (Ohio), Matthias Ritter of Hagerstown (Ind.), Hayden Stuckwisch of Brownstown (via Indiana State University), Marcus Drummer of Monroe Central (Ind.) and Jacob Drummer of Muncie (via Indiana Institute of Technology) in IU East's 2015 men's cross country and track and field recruiting class, with several more signings still expected.

IU East is an NAIA program. The Red Wolf cross country and track and field programs have been represented at the NAIA national meet six times in seven years of NAIA competition.
